    (hf : ∀ z₀ : ℂ, ∃ (s : Set ℂ) (c : ℕ → ℂ), IsOpen s ∧ z₀ ∈ s ∧
      ∀ z ∈ s, Tendsto (λ n => ∑ i in range n, (c i) * (z - z₀)^i) atTop (𝓝 (f z₀))
      ∧ ∃ i, c i = 0) :

name: exercise_4_15a
informal_prefix: /-- A continuous, strictly increasing function $\mu \colon (0, \infty) \rightarrow (0, \infty)$ is a modulus of continuity if $\mu(s) \rightarrow 0$ as $s \rightarrow 0$. A function $f \colon [a, b] \rightarrow \mathbb{R}$ has modulus of continuity $\mu$ if $|f(s) - f(t)| \leq \mu(|s - t|)$ for all $s, t \in [a, b]$. Prove that a function is uniformly continuous if and only if it has a modulus of continuity.-/
formal_statement:
theorem exercise_4_15a {α : Type*}
  (a b : ℝ) (F : Set (ℝ → ℝ)) :
  (∀ x : ℝ, ∀ ε > 0, ∃ U ∈ (𝓝 x),
  (∀ y z : U, ∀ f : ℝ → ℝ, f ∈ F → (dist (f y) (f z) < ε)))
  ↔
  ∃ (μ : ℝ → ℝ), ∀ (x : ℝ), (0 : ℝ) ≤ μ x ∧ Tendsto μ (𝓝 0) (𝓝 0) ∧
  (∀ (s t : ℝ) (f : ℝ → ℝ), f ∈ F → |(f s) - (f t)| ≤ μ (|s - t|)) :=
goal:
α : Type u_1
a b : ℝ
F : Set (ℝ → ℝ)
⊢ (∀ (x ε : ℝ), ε > 0 → ∃ U ∈ 𝓝 x, ∀ (y z : ↑U), ∀ f ∈ F, dist (f ↑y) (f ↑z) < ε) ↔
    ∃ μ, ∀ (x : ℝ), 0 ≤ μ x ∧ Tendsto μ (𝓝 0) (𝓝 0) ∧ ∀ (s t : ℝ), ∀ f ∈ F, |f s - f t| ≤ μ |s - t|

name: exercise_2017_b3
informal_prefix: /-- Suppose that $f(x)=\sum_{i=0}^{\infty} c_{i} x^{i}$ is a power series for which each coefficient $c_{i}$ is 0 or 1 . Show that if $f(2 / 3)=3 / 2$, then $f(1 / 2)$ must be irrational.-/
formal_statement:
theorem exercise_2017_b3 (f : ℝ → ℝ) (c : ℕ → ℝ)
  (hf : f = λ x => (∑' (i : ℕ), (c i) * x^i))
  (hc : ∀ n, c n = 0 ∨ c n = 1)
  (hf1 : f (2/3) = 3/2) :
  Irrational (f (1/2)) :=
goal:
f : ℝ → ℝ
c : ℕ → ℝ
hf : f = fun x => ∑' (i : ℕ), c i * x ^ i
hc : ∀ (n : ℕ), c n = 0 ∨ c n = 1
hf1 : f (2 / 3) = 3 / 2
⊢ Irrational (f (1 / 2))

name: exercise_1999_b4
informal_prefix: /-- Let $f$ be a real function with a continuous third derivative such that $f(x), f^{\prime}(x), f^{\prime \prime}(x), f^{\prime \prime \prime}(x)$ are positive for all $x$. Suppose that $f^{\prime \prime \prime}(x) \leq f(x)$ for all $x$. Show that $f^{\prime}(x)<2 f(x)$ for all $x$.-/
formal_statement:
theorem exercise_1999_b4 (f : ℝ → ℝ) (hf: ContDiff ℝ 3 f)
  (hf1 : ∀ n ≤ 3, ∀ x : ℝ, iteratedDeriv n f x > 0)
  (hf2 : ∀ x : ℝ, iteratedDeriv 3 f x ≤ f x) :
  ∀ x : ℝ, deriv f x < 2 * f x :=
goal:
f : ℝ → ℝ
hf : ContDiff ℝ 3 f
hf1 : ∀ n ≤ 3, ∀ (x : ℝ), iteratedDeriv n f x > 0
hf2 : ∀ (x : ℝ), iteratedDeriv 3 f x ≤ f x
⊢ ∀ (x : ℝ), deriv f x < 2 * f x
